text: Trinidad and Tobago women's national under-17 football team represents Trinidad and Tobago in youth soccer and they have hosted the 2010 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup. ==FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup== The team qualified for the first time in 2010.FIFA U-17 HistoryFIFA U-17 Women's World Cup Year Result Matches Wins Draws* Losses GF GA 2008 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify 2010 Group stage 3 1 0 2 3 4 2012 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify 2014 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify 2016 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify 2018 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Total 1/6 3 1 0 2 3 4 ==CONCACAF Women's U-17 Championship == Year Result Matches Wins Draws Losses GF GA 2008 Group stage 3 1 1 1 6 10 2010 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify 2012 Group stage 3 0 1 2 0 7 2013 Group stage 3 0 0 3 0 26 2016 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify 2018 Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify Did not qualify 2022 Group stage 3 0 0 3 1 19 Total 4/7 12 1 2 9 7 62 ===Previous squads=== :2010 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup == References == Category:North American women's national association football teams Category:Caribbean national football teams Category:National under-17 football teams Category:National sports teams of Trinidad and Tobago Category:Football in Trinidad and Tobago
